string-array.name: docs_app_modes_description
string-array.item: The control points of a Bézier curve can be entered by simply tapping on the touch screen. The control points are numbered in the order of their input. The current Bézier curve is displayed, if three or more control points exist.

Depending on the mode of the Bézier curves view, you can either add new control points, move existing ones or delete them (individually or all). The app mode is set by a drop-down menu:

Create - Input of control points
Move - Moving of control points
Delete - Deleting a control point
Clear - Clear all control points

In Create-mode, you can enter the control points of a Bézier curve by tapping. In Move-mode, you can move a specific control point by swiping. To do this, you must first touch the control point, then you can move the point.

Note: When moving a control point, the app is busy with a lot of computational operations (updating the Bézier curve). Therefore the app can loose its reference point to the touch gesture if wiping is too fast.

To delete a control point, switch to the Delete-mode. Select the point you want to delete with a one-finger tip. You can also delete the whole Bézier curve: To do this, switch to the Clear-mode. After deleting the curve, the app automatically switches to the Create-mode.

A special feature of this implementation is the combo box „Show Construction“. To demonstrate the internal operations of the algorithm of de Casteljau, the auxiliary points of the Casteljau scheme are calculated for the construction of the current Bézier point and additionally displayed in this view. This is of course only possible for a particular parameter t in the interval [0,1]. Use the second slider bar at the bottom (labelled „t“) to set this value.
